references.reason: This paper is a foundational work for the current state-of-the-art in diffusion models, introducing improvements that enhance the quality of generated samples.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling through stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This work provides a theoretically grounded framework for score-based generative models, establishing connections between diffusion processes and score estimation, which underpins the current work.

references.paper_title: Elucidating the design space of diffusion-based generative models
references.reason: This paper offers a comprehensive empirical study of diffusion models, significantly advancing practical implementation and providing valuable insights into the model's design space.

references.paper_title: Deep unsupervised learning using nonequilibrium thermodynamics
references.reason: This is among the earliest papers that introduced the concept of denoising diffusion models, laying the groundwork for subsequent advancements in the field.
This paper presents a practical implementation of diffusion models, demonstrating their effectiveness in generating high-quality samples from complex distributions.
